originalText.text: We had so much fun. Small museum tour was a nice size with highlights. Enjoyed the radio broadcast, model buildings and film clips with popcorn. Had a Friends moment. The ride at the end was really neat. Used sightseeing pass here.

text.text: We had so much fun. Small museum tour was a nice size with highlights. Enjoyed the radio broadcast, model buildings and film clips with popcorn. Had a Friends moment. The ride at the end was really neat. Used sightseeing pass here.

originalText.text: Located in the heart of Times Square, Rise NYC is one of the most coolest places I’ve been to. This really cool museum sends you through time to see how our great city grew over the years up to our current time! Rise NYC was fun and the ambassador’s there are amazing! I’d say definitely give it a try! You will leave happy you did!!

text.text: Located in the heart of Times Square, Rise NYC is one of the most coolest places I’ve been to. This really cool museum sends you through time to see how our great city grew over the years up to our current time! Rise NYC was fun and the ambassador’s there are amazing! I’d say definitely give it a try! You will leave happy you did!!

originalText.text: RiseNY is a relatively new attraction close to Times Square and it was fun! Tickets were available at the counter even on a weekend and is exactly the same price as you see online. As part of this attraction, you get to see a video on New York's evolution, then go through a small museum with displays on all famous attractions of NYC and finally get to go on a 4D ride that takes you through the famous New Year Eve's ball drop. The ride was thrilling and exciting! There is free popcorn available at one spot which was a really nice addition to have. The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because I felt that the price of $43.5 (after all additions) per person felt a little too high for the experience. This is going to be a one time visit for us.

originalText.text: RiseNY offers an immersive experience for New yorkers travelers, connecting them to the iconic landmarks and pop culture of New York City. Through informative exhibits and an exhilarating flight simulation ride, that is sure to blow your mind. visitors can explore museum-style galleries showcasing star-studded memorabilia, engaging displays, and realistic sets from popular television shows. An immersive movie narrated by Jeff Goldblum provides additional context, while the sensational ride takes guests 30 feet into the air, recreating the Manhattan skyline and offering a bird's eye view of the city Conveniently located near Times Square, RiseNY presents an ideal activity for those seeking an enriching and enjoyable experience during inclement weather.

originalText.text: Very nice experience.  If your in New York City there are plenty of things to do.  I recommend checking this on out, part museum part history lesson.  The Rise part is 4D, reminds me of one of the rides at Universal Orlando.  The Rise over NYC part was short but overall a great experience
